question: The formula to find the area of a trapezoid is:
remediation: The Formula to find the area of a Trapezoid is Length plus Length, Divided by two, Multiplied by Height. Length + Length / 2 x Height

question: What is the formula to find the area of a triangle?
remediation: The Formula to find the area of a Triangle is Base Multiplied by the Height, Divided by two. Base X Height / 2

question: How many square feet are in an acre?

remediation: 3.75 acres x 43,560 (sq/ft in an acre) = 163,350 sq/ft

question: What is the formula to calculate volume in cubic feet ?
remediation: The formula to calculate Volume in Cubic Feet is Height(Depth) X Width X Length

question: How many acres are in a square mile?
remediation: There are 640 acres in one square mile.

question: How many feet are in a rod?

Property taxes paid in arrears appear on the settlement statement as?

options.value: Credit to Seller and Credit to Buyer
Debit the Buyer and Debit the Seller
Debit the Seller and Credit the Buyer
Credit the Seller and Debit the Buyer

remediation: When a property sells during the year and the property taxes are paid in arrears the seller is debited a prorated tax amount for the days they owned the property and the credit for those days is given to the buyer.

options.value: (Monthly P&I Payment + 12 + Term) x Loan Amount
(Monthly P&I Payment x 12 x Term) x Loan Amount
(Monthly P & I Payment x 12 x Term) - Loan Amount
Monthly P & I Payments - 12- Term) x Loan Amount

remediation: The formula to find the total interest of a fully amortized loan is (Monthly P & I Payment x 12 x Term) - Loan Amount.

question: What four step formula is used to figure monthly principal and interest payment ?

remediation: One hundred percent of the original price of the home is $198,130. The home has appreciated 7%, making the homes new value 107% of the original value. $212,000 / 107% = $198,130 Original Cost

question: What is the perimeter of a 4 sided lot with the dimensions of side A-45’, side B-60’, side C-45’ side D-60’ ?
remediation: To find the perimeter of a property add the measurements of each side together. 45’ + 60’ + 45’ + 60’= 210 feet

question: Larry is selling his investment property for $615,000 which brings in $6,000 per month. What is the Gross Rent Multiplier?
remediation: To find the gross rent multiplier divide the property value by the monthly income. $615,000 / $6,000 = 102.5 GRM

question: Landlord Tony collects his rent on the 1st of the month. During the month Tony sold the property and $300 of the rent that was collected was due to be paid to the buyer. How should this appear on the settlement statement?

options.value: Debit the seller $300 credit the buyer $300

remediation: The seller has already collected the rent and is paying a portion at closing to the buyer for the days of the month the buyer will own the property. Debit the $300 of the collected rent and credit it to the buyer.

Appraiser Kim has a subject property with a $15,000 swimming pool. The comparable property does not have a pool. What adjustment will Kim make to the value?
remediation: When the subject property has a feature the comparable property does not add the value of the feature to the comparable properties value to best estimate the market value of the subject property.

question: Subject property does not have a fireplace, but the comparable has a nice gas log fireplace valued at $8,000 how would the appraiser adjust for this?

options.value: Add $8,000 to the value of the comparable
Subtract $8,000 from the value of the subject
Add $8,000 to the value of the subject
Subtract $8,000 from the value of the comparable

remediation: When the comparable property has a feature the subject property does not subtract the value of the feature from the comparable properties value to best estimate the market value of the subject property.

question: Rachel has an income goal of $75,000 this year in real estate. She earns 3% per sale. What must her sales volume be to meet her income goal?

Given the comparable information, what value would the appraiser give the subject property? Subject 1,500 sq/ft 2 bedroom 2 bath Comp1: 1,400sq/ft 2 bedroom 1 bath Sold $150,000, Comp 2: 1,400 sq/ft 2 bed 2 bath Sold $160,000, Comp 3: 1,500 sq/ft 2 bed 1 bath Sold $155,000
remediation: Appraisers make adjustments to the comparable based on differences or similarities of properties. The comp with 1,500 sq/ft sold for $5,000 more than the home with 1,400 sq/ft. The home with two bathrooms sold for $10,000 more than the home with only one bathroom. The adjustment of an additional $10,00 would be made to Comp 3 to be as similar to the subject as possible and result in a $165,000 appraised value on the subject property.
